item.title: Welcome to Vizzy!
item.description: üëã Welcome to Vizzy! Get ready to bring your music to life! Vizzy is a free, online music visualizer editor that lets you create stunning, unique videos that react to your audio ...

item.title: Rendering to a buffer
item.description: Rendering to a buffer Each layer in Vizzy can be rendered to a buffer.

item.title: What is a layer?
item.description: What is a layer? Layers are objects in Vizzy through which items are rendered to the screen or to a buffer. highlight Layer types There are two layer types in Vizzy - 2D and 3D (Orthographic and Perspective), we might also call them camera types.

item.title: What is an item?
item.description: What is an item? An Item is its own little contained renderer, producing an image to a buffer.

item.title: How Vizzy Works
item.description: ‚öôÔ∏è How Vizzy Works Vizzy is a bit different from many other online video creation tools. Here‚Äôs the magic behind it: Local rendering Vizzy does all of its rendering directly in your web browser.

item.title: What is a buffer?
item.description: What is a buffer? A buffer is defined as a region of memory that holds the data for an image to be displayed on a screen. Think of it as a ‚Äòscreen‚Äô. Vizzy has two buffer types.
